sn35.94:4.1: This series of verses resembles those attributed to Vardhamāna (Mahāvīra) at Isibhāsiyāiṁ 29. The same series of verses also contains parallels to Snp 5.2:3.1, SN 1.6:3.1, and DN 2:29.4 = MN 56:12.2.
sn35.94:8.3: The mention of “duality” links this to the preceding two discourses.
sn35.94:9.2: “Attraction” (upāya, verb form upeti, here spelled upayanti) is the initial stage in the process of becoming attached (eg. SN 12.15:2.5).
sn35.94:9.3: This unusual use of manomayaṁ (normally “mind-made”, here “mental construction”) parallels vitakkaṁ at Thag 21.1:6.2.
